description: Is data stored in shared tables with tenant_id filtering, or separate databases per customer?
Can a single user belong to multiple tenant accounts?
How do you handle tenant-level feature flags?
What happens when a tenant's subscription lapses? Read-only mode? Full lockout? Grace period? Data retention?
How do you handle tenant data deletion requests?
Can tenants have sub-tenants?
How do you handle cross-tenant data?
What's the tenant provisioning workflow?
How do you handle tenant-specific customizations that don't belong in the core product?
What's the maximum number of concurrent users per tenant? Per the platform? Load testing targets?
How do you handle tenant-level backup and restore?
Can tenants export ALL their data at any time?
How do you handle tenant data migration FROM another platform?
What's the data residency requirement?
How do you handle tenant-level rate limiting?
Every workflow must be configurable — who approves what, at what thresholds, in what order. How is this configuration UI designed?
Cost code structures vary wildly between builders. How do you handle custom cost code hierarchies?
Job phases and naming conventions differ. How do you let each builder define their own phase structure?
Terminology varies — some say "trade partner," some say "subcontractor," some say "vendor." Can terminology be customized per tenant?
Document templates must be fully customizable per tenant. How?
Numbering conventions differ — some want CO-001, some want 2024-AMI-CO-001. Configurable numbering schemes?
Approval workflows differ — some builders need 3-level approval, others just need the owner to click approve. Configurable?
What custom fields can tenants create?
Can tenants create custom dropdown values?
Can tenants create custom report templates?
Can tenants configure their own dashboard layouts?
How do you handle configuration changes mid-project?
Can tenants set default values per field?
Can tenants configure required fields?
Can tenants create conditional logic?
How do you handle configuration versioning?
Can tenants clone another tenant's configuration as a starting template?
What's the "out of the box" configuration for a new customer? Does it work for day 1, or require hours of setup?
How many configuration options are TOO many?
Can configuration be done by the builder, or does it require your team?
Tax rules vary by state, county, and municipality. The system must support configurable tax rules per jurisdiction.
Lien law varies by state — notice requirements, deadlines, waiver forms. Must be configurable.
Building codes vary by jurisdiction. Checklists, inspection types, and compliance requirements must be location-aware.
Permit types and processes vary by municipality. Must be configurable per jurisdiction.
Insurance requirements vary by state. Minimum coverage amounts, required endorsements — configurable.
Contract law varies by state. Template contracts must have state-specific language options.
Weather patterns vary by region. Scheduling intelligence must account for regional climate.
Material pricing varies by region. Intelligence engine must be region-aware.
Labor rates vary by region. Cost benchmarks must be region-adjusted.
Holidays vary — some regions observe local holidays that affect scheduling.
Work hour restrictions vary by municipality.
Environmental regulations vary.
Business licensing requirements vary by jurisdiction.
Sales tax rules for construction vary by state — some tax materials, some tax labor, some neither.
Mechanic's lien procedures and statutory forms vary by state.
What does a new customer see when they first log in? Empty dashboard is overwhelming. Guided setup wizard?
How long should it take from "I signed up" to "I'm getting value"? Target: under 1 hour for basic functionality.
Can the system generate a sample/demo project so the customer can explore features before entering real data?
What's the minimum data entry required before the system is useful?
How do you handle customers with ZERO historical data vs. customers with 10 years of data to import?
What's the onboarding flow for each user ROLE?
Is there an interactive tutorial or walkthrough for each module?
How do you handle the "I don't have time for setup" customer? Pre-built templates? Concierge setup service?
What happens when a customer starts the onboarding wizard but doesn't finish? Resume later? Reminders?
How do you handle customers who want to run the old system AND the new system in parallel during transition?

What about importing from Google Sheets, Airtable, or Monday.com?

Can customers do partial migrations?

How do you verify migration accuracy?
What about migrating active projects vs. completed projects?

How do you share best practices between customers?
What about case studies — can successful customers share their results?
What's the pricing structure? Per user? Per project? Per revenue? Flat fee? Tiered?

What about a partner/referral program? Discount for referring other builders?
How do you handle pricing for add-on services?

How do you handle tax on SaaS subscriptions?
What about international billing if you expand beyond the US? Currency, tax, regulations?
How do you handle refunds? Full, partial, prorated?
What about tracking MRR , churn rate, LTV, CAC for your own business?

Client goes bankrupt mid-construction. System must support lien filing documentation, partial billing, project hold, and eventual close-out.
Builder acquires another builder's in-progress project. How do you onboard a project mid-stream?
Builder needs to fire a subcontractor mid-scope. System must support contractor replacement workflow — termination documentation, scope reassignment, schedule impact, cost reconciliation.
Project paused for 12 months . System must handle: vendor contract suspension, permit extensions, schedule restart, cost escalation recalculation.
Property sold during construction. Contract assignment, new owner portal access, closing documentation.
Architect fired mid-project. New architect onboarding, plan revision management, responsibility transition.
Client divorce during construction. Potential dual communication requirements, split decision authority, legal sensitivity.
Builder's key employee dies or becomes incapacitated. System must have complete project documentation that someone else can pick up and continue.
Material supplier goes bankrupt. Deposit recovery tracking, alternative sourcing, schedule impact, substitution approvals.
Building department changes requirements mid-project. Tracking new requirements, additional costs, plan revision cycle.
Adjacent property owner sues to stop construction. Legal hold documentation, communication restrictions, project pause workflow.
Client wants to self-perform some work. Owner-builder scope tracking, insurance requirements, quality acceptance, warranty exclusions.
Project is featured on TV/magazine. Photo approval workflows, NDA management, site visit scheduling.
Builder expands into light commercial. System must handle different contract types, prevailing wage, bonding, and reporting requirements.
Natural disaster damages an in-progress project. Insurance claim documentation, reconstruction scope, schedule rebuild, client communication.
Pandemic causes work stoppage. Force majeure documentation, vendor payment pause, schedule extension, remote management.
Builder decides to sell the business. System must produce comprehensive business documentation — active projects, pipeline, vendor relationships, financial history.
Multiple builders on the platform work on the same subdivision. How do you handle shared infrastructure costs, common area budgets, and HOA formation?
Client wants to build an ADU alongside main home. Same project? Separate project? Different permits, possibly different code requirements.
Builder takes on a joint venture project with another builder. How does data sharing work? Especially if both are on the platform?
Local building code adopts a new edition mid-year. How does the system flag affected active projects and updated inspection requirements?
Builder hires a construction manager / owner's rep who needs oversight access to everything.

How does the system assist with mechanic's lien documentation by state?
What about discovery/litigation hold?
How do you handle OSHA citation documentation and response tracking?
What about construction defect claim workflows by state?
How do you handle warranty claim dispute resolution documentation?
What about expert witness documentation support?
How do you handle non-compete and non-solicitation tracking?
What about contract interpretation disputes?
How do you handle government audit preparation?
Client overpays — refund processing and tracking
Vendor underpays a credit — collection and dispute tracking
Construction loan with unusual draw structures — configurable draw schedules
Multiple funding sources — client pays some, lender funds some, investor funds some
Barter arrangements — vendor trades work for other consideration
Escrow requirements for deposits — jurisdiction-specific rules
Insurance proceeds after damage — tracking, applying to reconstruction costs
Cost-plus audit by client — system must support transparent cost documentation and export
Progress billing when work is complete but not inspected — billing rules configurable
Force majeure financial impact — cost escalation, extended general conditions, remobilization costs
Bonus/penalty clauses — milestone tracking with automatic financial calculation
Liquidated damages — daily rate calculation when project exceeds completion date
Shared costs between projects — configurable allocation methods
Year-end financial close processes — preventing changes to closed periods
Multi-year project financial reporting — costs span multiple fiscal years
Currency conversion for imported materials — exchange rate tracking
Contingency drawdown authorization — configurable approval requirements
Budget contingency reallocation — moving contingency funds to specific cost codes with documentation
Profit margin analysis that accounts for change orders, warranty costs, and general conditions overrun
Cash-basis vs. accrual-basis reporting toggle — each builder's accountant has preferences
System access during multi-day power outage — mobile app with extensive offline capability
Photo metadata discrepancies — camera time vs. phone time vs. server time
Large plan set rendering on mobile devices — progressive loading, zoom performance
Field connectivity — dead zones on islands, basements, rural areas — robust offline mode
Device diversity — old iPads, cheap Android phones, brand-new iPhones — graceful degradation
Browser compatibility — Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge — consistent experience
Print formatting — reports, schedules, budgets must print cleanly on standard paper
Email deliverability — automated notifications not going to spam
Data export volume — builder wants to export 5 years of data — performance and format considerations
API rate limiting for integrations — prevent overwhelming third-party services
File format handling — PDFs, DWGs, Excel, Word, images, videos — all need appropriate viewing/processing
Character set handling — accented characters in names, addresses
Session management across devices — login on phone, continue on desktop seamlessly
Deep linking — link in an email goes directly to the specific invoice/task/document
Concurrent user performance — 50 users from one builder all logged in simultaneously
Search performance — full-text search across millions of documents and records
Notification delivery timing — urgent alerts within 30 seconds, not queued for 5 minutes
Mobile app update management — force update for critical fixes, optional for features
Third-party dependency management — what if a key service changes pricing or goes down?
Data anonymization for demo/sales purposes — show real-looking data without revealing actual customer data

How do you handle the "we need it NOW" features vs. the "this would be cool someday" features?
What's the team?

What's the timeline to first external customer?

What's the support model as you scale?
Estimate line item → Budget line item → PO → Invoice → Payment → Lien waiver → Draw request — FULL CHAIN must be traceable.
Plan upload → AI takeoff → Estimate → Bid package → Vendor bid → Bid comparison → Contract → PO → Schedule task — FULL CHAIN.
Daily log "delay reported" → Schedule impact calculation → Revised completion date → Client notification — AUTOMATED.
Selection made → Budget impact calculated → Change order generated → Client approval → PO generated → Delivery tracked → Installation scheduled — AUTOMATED.
Invoice received → AI extraction → Cost code suggestion → Budget impact calculated → Approval routed → Payment scheduled → Lien waiver requested → Draw request updated — AUTOMATED.
Punch item created → Assigned to vendor → Vendor notified → Vendor marks complete → Builder verifies → Photos documented → Item closed — FULL WORKFLOW.
Insurance certificate uploaded → Expiration date extracted → Calendar reminder set → Renewal request auto-sent 30 days before expiration — AUTOMATED.
Vendor bid received → AI parses line items → Compares to estimate → Compares to other bids → Compares to historical data → Recommendation generated — AUTOMATED.
RFI created → Routed to architect → Response received → Cost impact assessed → Change order created → Budget updated → Schedule updated — FULL CHAIN.
Client selection → Lead time calculated → Order date calculated → Schedule constraint created → Order reminder triggered → PO generated → Delivery tracked — FULL CHAIN.
Failed inspection → Responsible trade identified → Correction assigned → Re-inspection scheduled → Passed → Schedule updated — FULL WORKFLOW.
Weather forecast → At-risk tasks identified → Team notified → Schedule auto-adjusted → Daily log auto-populated with weather data — AUTOMATED.
Employee certification expiration → Alert generated → Training scheduled → Certification updated → Compliance report updated — AUTOMATED.
Project completion → Warranty start dates set → Home care schedule generated → Client portal transitions to warranty mode → Vendor warranty responsibilities documented — AUTOMATED.
Change order approved → Contract value updated → Budget updated → Schedule impact applied → Draw request schedule adjusted → Client portal updated — ALL SIMULTANEOUS.

Marketing campaign management — track ROI by channel (Houzz, website, social, referral, Parade of Homes, print)
Website integration — lead capture forms that auto-create leads in the pipeline
SEO/content tracking — which blog posts, portfolio pages drive inquiries
Networking/event tracking — track industry events, builder association meetings, relationships cultivated
Strategic lot tracking — monitor lots for sale that match your ideal build profile
Builder reputation monitoring — track online reviews across Google, Houzz, BBB, Yelp; alert on new reviews
Competitive intelligence — track competitor pricing trends, new starts, marketing activity (manual entry)
Multi-channel lead intake — website form, phone log, email, referral, Houzz message, walk-in → all land in one pipeline
Automated lead response — configurable auto-reply acknowledging inquiry within minutes
Lead scoring algorithm — budget realism (Do they own a lot? Is financing pre-approved? Is their budget realistic for what they want?), timeline fit, project type match, referral source quality
Lead nurturing sequences — automated email drips configurable per builder (monthly newsletter, recent project showcase, educational content)
Initial consultation checklist — configurable list of questions for the first meeting (budget, lot, timeline, must-haves, design preferences, previous building experience)
Consultation notes and follow-up tracking — what was discussed, what were their reactions, next steps, follow-up date
"Dream board" capture — log the client's inspiration images, must-have features, lifestyle needs during initial conversations

Lot evaluation checklist — if they have a lot: zoning, setbacks, easements, flood zone, soil conditions, utility availability, HOA restrictions, tree survey, survey availability, environmental concerns
Quick feasibility calculator — "Based on your lot, your wishes, and current costs, a rough range is $X-$Y" — configurable formula per builder
Design team assembly — track architect, engineer, interior designer, landscape architect with contact info, contracts, and deadlines
Design milestone tracking — concept → schematic → design development → construction documents, with client review gates at each
Design meeting management — schedule, agenda, attendees, minutes, decisions, action items for every design meeting
Preliminary budget tracking across design iterations — as design develops, estimate updates at each milestone to keep client informed
Preconstruction agreement management — separate contract for paid design/planning phase; track billing against this separately from construction
Geotechnical report tracking — soil boring results, foundation recommendations, cost implications
Survey management — boundary, topographic, tree, and elevation surveys; track who ordered, when received, results
Environmental assessment tracking — wetlands delineation, protected species surveys, stormwater requirements
HOA/deed restriction checklist — architectural review board requirements, submission deadlines, approval status
Utility coordination tracker — water, sewer, electric, gas, cable/internet — application status, connection fees, timeline
Impact fee calculator — by jurisdiction; school impact, transportation impact, park impact, fire impact fees
Design coordination issue log — track conflicts between architectural, structural, MEP, and interior design; who needs to resolve what
Plan set distribution management — track which version of plans went to which vendors, with read receipts
Bid invitation tracking — who was invited, who declined, who acknowledged, who submitted, who is late
Bid leveling tools — normalize bids from different vendors to compare apples to apples (some include dumpster, some don't; some include permit, some don't)
Scope gap detection — AI identifies items in the plans that no vendor bid covers (the "who's responsible for this?" gap)
Value engineering tracker — alternative approaches that save money without sacrificing quality; track options presented to client with savings amounts
Allowance strategy builder — for items not yet selected, set allowance amounts based on intelligence engine (historical data for similar selections at this tier)
Estimate presentation builder — generate client-facing estimate at configurable detail level with builder branding
Pre-construction cost tracker — design fees, engineering, survey, geotech, permit fees, impact fees — all tracked separately from construction budget
Construction cost escalation calculator — if project won't start for 6 months, estimate material/labor cost increases
Contract type configurator — cost-plus, GMP, fixed-price, hybrid — each with different tracking requirements
Contract milestone/draw schedule builder — link contract payment milestones to construction schedule milestones
Financing coordination tracker — construction loan application status, appraisal management, lender requirements, inspection schedule
Lender draw format manager — different lenders require different draw formats; store and manage lender-specific templates
Title company coordination — track title insurance, closing documents, earnest money, survey requirements
Insurance setup checklist — Builder's Risk policy per project; track policy number, coverage amount, deductible, effective dates, premium
Notice to Owner management — track NTO requirements by state; who has filed, deadlines, documentation
Pre-construction meeting management — attendee list, agenda template, meeting minutes, project kickoff documentation
Tree protection plan documentation — which trees are protected, fencing requirements, monitoring during construction
Erosion control plan tracking — SWPPP installation, inspection schedule, maintenance log
Temporary utilities setup — temporary power, water, portable toilet delivery/service schedule
Site security setup — fencing, locks, camera installation, alarm system
Dumpster/waste management scheduling — delivery, pickup, recycling requirements
Material staging plan — where materials will be stored, delivery access routes, crane placement
Neighbor notification management — courtesy notices about construction start, hours, contact information
Foundation type tracking — slab, crawlspace, basement, pilings, auger cast — configurable per project and region
Foundation inspection checklist — configurable by foundation type and jurisdiction
Concrete supplier coordination — mix design approval, delivery scheduling, testing requirements
Pile driving/foundation subcontractor coordination — for coastal elevated construction: pile specifications, driving records, load testing
Waterproofing/damp-proofing tracking — material specifications, installation documentation, warranty registration
Under-slab MEP rough-in coordination — plumbing, electrical, HVAC duct that must be in before slab pour
Foundation survey/as-built — verify foundation matches plans; document any deviations
Lumber/material delivery scheduling — coordinated with framing start; track multiple deliveries
Framing progress tracking — wall framing, roof trusses, sheathing, each tracked as sub-tasks
Structural steel/engineered beam tracking — fabrication lead time, delivery date, installation sequence
Window and door schedule management — order tracking from selection through fabrication, delivery, and installation
Rough opening verification — confirm all openings match window/door order before closing walls
Structural inspection coordination — schedule with building department; pre-inspection checklist
Roofing material and installation tracking — underlayment, flashing, finish roofing material
Exterior wall weather barrier/wrap — installation documentation and inspection
Window and door installation tracking — each unit tracked for installation quality checklist
Exterior cladding coordination — siding, stucco, stone, brick — multiple trades potentially on exterior simultaneously
Flashing and waterproofing details — critical junction points documented with photos
Plumbing rough-in checklist — fixture locations, pipe sizing, water heater location, gas line routing
Electrical rough-in checklist — panel location, circuit layout, fixture boxes, low-voltage pre-wire
HVAC rough-in checklist — duct routing, equipment placement, return air, fresh air, exhaust fans
Low-voltage/smart home pre-wire — network, audio, security, camera, motorized shades, lighting control
Fire sprinkler rough-in — if required: design, installation, inspection tracking
MEP coordination conflicts — track and resolve conflicts between plumbing, electrical, HVAC, and structural
Insulation inspection checklist — R-values by location, installation quality, vapor barrier
MEP rough-in inspection coordination — schedule all trade inspections; track pass/fail; re-inspection if needed
Drywall tracking — hanging, taping, texture, by room/area
Interior paint tracking — primer, color by room, sheen, touch-up tracking
Tile installation tracking — by room, material, pattern, grout color
Hardwood/flooring installation tracking — material, direction, transition details
Cabinet installation checklist — by room; verify against shop drawings; punch list
Countertop fabrication and installation — template date, fabrication timeline, installation date
Millwork/trim installation — crown, base, casing, built-ins; by room
Hardware installation — door hardware, cabinet hardware, bath accessories
Appliance delivery and installation tracking — each appliance: model, serial number, delivery date, installation date, warranty registration
Fixture installation tracking — plumbing fixtures, light fixtures, ceiling fans — each tracked
Driveway and walkway — concrete, pavers, or other; pour/install dates
Landscaping coordination — grading, irrigation, planting, sod, mulch, lighting
Pool/spa construction tracking — if applicable: separate permit, separate contractor, own inspection sequence
Outdoor kitchen/living area — separate scope tracking
Fencing — permit, installation, inspection
Garage door installation — order, delivery, installation, programming
Mailbox, house numbers, exterior accessories
Exterior paint/stain — body, trim, accents; touch-up
Gutter and downspout installation
Screen enclosure — if applicable (common in Florida)
Pre-final inspection walkthrough — builder's internal punch list BEFORE requesting CO inspection
Final building inspection coordination — schedule, attend, document results
Certificate of Occupancy tracking — application, inspection, issuance, conditions
Utility final connections — meter sets, final connections, service activation
Final cleaning coordination — construction clean, detail clean, window clean
Client orientation meeting — walk through entire home demonstrating all systems, features, maintenance requirements
O&M manual assembly — all manuals, warranties, paint codes, material specs, as-built plans compiled for homeowner
Warranty start date documentation — establish start dates for builder warranty, manufacturer warranties, workmanship warranties
Key/access handover log — all keys, garage remotes, gate codes, alarm codes, smart home credentials
Final photography — professional photos for portfolio, marketing, and homeowner record
Client satisfaction survey — post-move-in feedback; configurable timing and questions
30-day walkthrough — scheduled follow-up to identify settling items, adjustment needs
11-month walkthrough — before 1-year warranty expiration; comprehensive inspection
Warranty request intake — client-facing portal for submitting service requests with photos
Warranty triage — is this a warranty item, maintenance, or homeowner damage? Decision workflow
Warranty vendor dispatch — route to responsible trade; track response time and completion
Warranty cost tracking — by vendor, by item type, by project; feeds future estimating for warranty reserves
Seasonal maintenance reminders — automated reminders to homeowner (change HVAC filter, flush water heater, etc.)
Home care subscription management — if builder offers ongoing maintenance service
"My Day" dashboard — everything I need to address today across all projects, sorted by priority
Overnight alert review — what happened since I left yesterday: emails received, vendor messages, inspection results, weather changes
Daily cash position — what's in the bank, what's due out today/this week, what draws are pending
Schedule review across all jobs — who's going where today, any conflicts, any weather issues
Material delivery schedule — what's arriving today on which job sites
Inspection schedule — which inspections are today, who's meeting the inspector
Client communication queue — any client messages needing response; any scheduled client meetings today
Vendor follow-up queue — outstanding bids, overdue invoices, unanswered RFIs, expired insurance
One-tap daily log start — auto-populates date, weather, project, yesterday's vendors; just add today's info
Quick photo capture — snap photo → auto-tagged to project, date, and location; optional voice note overlay
Quick issue reporting — photo + voice note + category + urgency → creates issue, assigns, notifies
Material delivery verification — scan packing slip or take photo → match to PO → flag discrepancies
Inspection result logging — pass/fail + inspector notes + photos → auto-updates schedule + daily log
Vendor check-in/check-out — track who's on site and when (optional GPS verification)
Quick measurement/note — capture a field measurement or decision with photo context
Safety observation — quick log of safety concern with photo → routes to safety manager
Client site visit logging — client was on site; document any decisions, questions, concerns raised
Change directive capture — field decision that will become a change order; document now, formalize later
Daily log review and submission — review all logs submitted by field staff; approve or request edits
Invoice processing queue — review AI-extracted invoices; approve/code/dispute
Schedule updates — adjust based on today's progress; push notifications to affected trades
Client update generation — AI drafts weekly/daily updates based on daily logs and photos; PM reviews and sends
Tomorrow's plan — review schedule for tomorrow; confirm vendor starts; check material deliveries
Cash flow projection review — updated projections for all active projects
Budget variance review — any line items trending over budget; action plans
Schedule health review — critical path analysis; any projects at risk
Vendor performance review — any vendors underperforming this week
Draw request preparation — compile approved invoices, lien waivers, photos for next draw
Prospect/lead follow-up — pipeline review; schedule follow-up calls/meetings
Team meeting preparation — auto-generated agenda from project data
WIP (Work in Progress) report generation — for accountant; over/under billing analysis
Profitability review by project — which jobs are making money, which aren't, why
Insurance certificate review — any expiring this month across all vendors
License renewal review — any licenses expiring for vendors or the builder
Marketing activity review — leads by source, conversion rates, marketing spend ROI
Client satisfaction pulse — any active clients who haven't been communicated with recently
Vendor payment aging review — who are we behind on paying? Cash flow implications?
Tax preparation support — 1099 generation, sales tax filing data, quarterly tax estimates
Insurance audit data preparation — payroll by class code, subcontractor spend by trade
Business performance review — year-over-year comparison, trend analysis, KPI scorecards
Strategic planning data — pipeline forecast, capacity planning, market trends
Employee review data — PM profitability rankings, super quality metrics, admin efficiency
Estimate Intelligence — After 10+ completed projects, AI can generate a preliminary estimate from floor plans + finish level within +/-15% accuracy
Schedule Intelligence — AI predicts realistic durations based on project size, complexity, season, region, and builder's historical performance
Vendor Matching — "For this scope on this type of project, these 3 vendors historically perform best for you"
Price Anomaly Detection — "This invoice is 40% higher than the last 5 similar invoices from this vendor — review?"
Budget Forecasting — "Based on current spending rate, this project will finish $23K over budget. Here are the 3 line items driving the overrun."
Change Order Prediction — "Based on 50 similar projects, clients typically add a pool during framing. Proactively discuss?"
Schedule Risk Prediction — "Based on weather forecast and current pace, there's a 72% chance of missing the drywall deadline. Recommend: schedule 2-day buffer."
Document Auto-Classification — Email attachment or upload → AI identifies: invoice, bid, COI, lien waiver, plan set, permit, inspection report
Daily Log Intelligence — AI reads daily logs and detects: potential delays, safety concerns, scope changes, quality issues, vendor problems
Cash Flow Optimization — "If you submit Draw #4 by Friday, you'll avoid a cash flow gap next Tuesday. Here's the package ready for review."
Client Communication Drafting — AI drafts weekly client updates from daily logs, photos, and schedule data. PM reviews and sends.
Scope Gap Detection — Compare all vendor contracts to the complete scope of work → identify items nobody is responsible for
Photo-Based Progress Assessment — AI analyzes site photos to estimate construction progress percentage (future feature, high R&D)
Warranty Prediction — "Based on historical warranty claims, homes with [this vendor's] plumbing rough-in have 3x more warranty calls. Consider additional inspection."
Seasonal Pattern Learning — "October is historically your busiest month for permit delays in Manatee County. Submit permits 2 weeks earlier."
Profitability Pattern Analysis — "Projects where selections are finalized before framing average 8% higher profit margin. Push for earlier selection deadlines."
Bank feed integration — Auto-import bank transactions for reconciliation against invoiced/paid items
Credit card feed — Auto-capture receipts from company cards; match to cardholders; route for job cost coding
Construction camera integration — EarthCam, Sensera, Ring cameras — auto-pull time-lapse and live feeds into project dashboard
Drone service integration — DroneDeploy, Skydio — import survey data, orthomosaic maps, progress photos
Material supplier portals — ABC Supply, 84 Lumber, ProBuild, Ferguson — order status, pricing, delivery tracking
Appliance dealer integration — Ferguson, Yale Appliance — selections, pricing, delivery scheduling
Title company integration — share draw documentation, lien waiver packages, closing documents
Surveyor integration — receive digital survey data directly into the platform
Energy modeling tools — HERS rating, Manual J/D calculations
Smart home platform integration — Savant, Control4, Crestron — system specifications, pre-wire documentation
Dumpster/portable toilet vendor — automated scheduling based on construction phase
Equipment rental companies — Sunbelt, United Rentals — auto-track rental periods, costs, delivery/pickup
State contractor licensing databases — auto-verify vendor licenses are active and in good standing
FEMA flood map API — auto-determine flood zone from project address
NOAA weather API — historical weather data for schedule intelligence, real-time forecasts for daily operations
Tide data API — for coastal builders; schedule concrete pours and foundation work around tides
Building code database — ICC codes with jurisdiction-specific amendments
Email integration — forward emails to the system; auto-file to correct project/vendor based on AI analysis
Calendar sync — Google Calendar, Outlook, Apple Calendar — two-way sync of inspections, meetings, milestones
Zapier/Make connector — for any integration we don't natively support
SOC 2 Type II compliance — required for enterprise customers
GDPR compliance framework — if expanding internationally
CCPA compliance — California customers' data rights
State-specific data privacy laws — emerging laws in TX, FL, CO, VA, CT
PCI DSS compliance — if handling payment card data
Data encryption at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.3)
Multi-factor authentication — configurable per tenant
Single Sign-On (SSO) — Azure AD, Google Workspace, Okta
IP allowlisting — optional per tenant
Session management — configurable timeout, forced logout, concurrent session limits
Audit logging — every data access, every change, every login; immutable; searchable
Role-based access control (RBAC) — granular to the field level
Data retention policies — configurable per tenant; automated enforcement
Right to erasure — complete data deletion workflow
Penetration testing — quarterly; results documented
Vulnerability scanning — continuous; automated patching
Incident response plan — documented and tested
Business continuity plan — documented and tested
Disaster recovery — RPO < 1 hour, RTO < 4 hours
Data export — complete data export in standard formats at any time (NEVER lock in customers like Buildertrend does)
